meanings.definition: To remove residue from the bottom of a pan by adding liquid and stirring.
meanings.sent1: After cooking the meat, I will deglaze the pan to make a tasty sauce.
meanings.sent2: The chef always deglazes the pan with wine to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally deglazed the pan with water instead of broth, creating a bland sauce.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking to deglaze the situation with humor diffused the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle and steam as you deglaze the pan make cooking exciting and aromatic.

meanings.definition: The liquid used to remove residue from the bottom of a pan.
meanings.sent1: The flavorful deglaze from the pan added richness to the sauce.
meanings.sent2: She poured the deglaze into a separate container to use for basting later.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled the deglaze, causing a slippery mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The deglaze acted as a magic potion, transforming the plain dish into a gourmet meal.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the deglaze filled the kitchen, signaling a delicious meal in the making.
